title: The Spiritual Guide to Coping With Grief and Loss — with Amanda Kloots
description:
This BIG TALK episode of Dear Gabby is all about love, loss and connection to Spirit. My guest, Amanda Kloots, is an expert on finding grace within grief. Her story is heartbreaking, but it’s also proof that you can have have a very real relationship with a deceased loved one. Amanda is a living testimony to love after loss. I can’t wait for you to bask in her light.

Amanda and I talk about:

  • How to connect to your Spirit Guides
  • How to develop and fine-tune your relationship with someone after they’ve passed
  • How to move past fear and into comfort after loss
  • Honoring your whole spectrum of emotions as you find your way back to joy
  • The art of keeping things in the day
  • Tools to feel less alone after loss


Amanda’s story is heartbreaking. But it’s also deeply inspiring. Especially if you’ve lost a loved one, my hope is that this episode opens you up to the idea that you can welcome a new relationship. I hope this awakens your desire to connect with Spirit.

RESOURCES:

The following are helpful resources and books I mention within the episode:

ABOUT AMANDA KLOOTS: Amanda is a former Broadway dancer, cohost of The Talk on CBS, and author of the New York Times bestseller Live Your Life: My Story of Loving and Losing Nick Codero:  https://amzn.to/2XYnVaJ


MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES

  • Safety, Recovery and Mental Health Resources: https://bit.ly/3Auv5BR
  • Mental Health Resources and My Story of Recovery from Postpartum Anxiety and Depression: https://bit.ly/3hS2Q98
  • How to Handle Sadness During the Pandemic: https://bit.ly/2VZUTHe
  • My proven tools for releasing anxiety and feeling calm: Free Anxiety Relief Workshop: https://bit.ly/3ExKaoZ

MIRACLE MEMBERSHIP
Want even more support? I created the Miracle Membership to help you design a spiritual practice you can stick to—so you can feel connected, supported and inspired every day. Each month I deliver brand new workshops, guided meditations, live group meditations, community connection, and so much more. Plus, it’s easy to access on your phone, computer or tablet.
